content:
I'm aware of the old topos library from Lean 3, and was wondering how much of that has made its way into mathlib so far.

I can't seem to find the definition of a topos anywhere, but I do know that various results from that old library are now scattered throughout mathlib; namely, I'm aware of the overlap in content with Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Subobject. I am also sure there's plenty of relevant content in Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Sites.

If anyone happens to know of any ongoing projects to add this content to mathlib, please let me know; I would be interested in helping.
There are sheaf toposes at docs4#CategoryTheory.Sheaf . Afaik the definition of elementary toposes has not made it over.

Not much made it into mathlib directly, but most of the material on cartesian closed categories, sites and subobjects started in that repo. There aren't any active projects to add it to mathlib, which is almost exclusively because I don't have time for it. If you're interested in helping we can coordinate how best to make this happen, send me a DM! :)
Charlie Conneen has marked this topic as resolved.
